result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeramy Michael Vadner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeramy Michael Vadner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeramy Michael Vadner was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with 13CF326, 13CF313 and 13CF391.
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation by October 16, 2015.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 13CF326, 13CF313 and 13CF391

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Jeramy Michael Vadner appeared.  Court called at 9:15 a.m. Includes 15CM247 & 15CM417.  Set for PTC.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.    Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 15CM247. Crt reviews the City of New Richmond Police Report for review.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated  guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM247. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & 3 in 15CM247.   State will draft a Stipulation for  the resolution of 15CM417 to be approved by Branch 3.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 in 15CM247
- S/W 1 year probation with conditions concurrent with 13CF326, 13CF313 & 13CF391
- Restitution to Walmart in the amount of $52.73 to be paid joint and several with the other co-defendents.
- Court Costs of $243.00 and $200 for the DNA surcharge  
- DE to meet with the payment clerk for a payment plan
- DE to report to probation by 10/16/15
- DEs bond remains in effect until he is signed up with probation and then it is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference at 10-15-2015 09:00 am

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Jeramy Michael Vadner did not appear.  Court called at 1:15 p.m.  Attorney Harrelson advises the court the DE is in Branch 3 signing a bond.  State is working on a global resolution and asking to continue the PTC.  Continue the PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Filed by Atty Kemp. km
Appointing Atty Kemp. km
Pre-trial conference on June 15, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Wal-Mart or premises in  New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
